intro: Gnaphaliothamnus lavandulifolius, commonly known as silverleaf thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, and its spiny, spherical seed heads. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to drought conditions and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
